intro: Leucas abyssinica var. abyssinica, commonly known as Ethiopian leucas, is a herbaceous plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which attract pollinators such as bees. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
